climbs.name: Heartless
climbs.fa: Dennis Yates and Roger Linfield, February, 1987

content.description: Climb the handcrack in the left-facing dihedral.  This is a good warm-up route on a cold day.
content.location: This is an obvious, 40' long, left-facing dihedral on the south side of a rock.  It's about half way from the main wash intersection to where the wash turns west.

climbs.name: Fool For A Pretty Face
climbs.fa: Dennis Yates and Roger Linfield, March 1987

content.description: Do a hard (5.10c) move past the first bolt and move left to the arete.  Exciting and somewhat runout moves above the third bolt take you to the top.
content.protection: Three bolts for protection, with a two bolt belay/rappel anchor on top.
content.location: This climb is on a large boulder with a striking northwest arete.  It is 200-300 yards northwest of the Beak Boulders, and on the east side of the wash.

climbs.name: Crack Addiction
climbs.fa: Roger Linfield and Dennis Yates, Feb. 1987

content.description: Climb the crack, using a fun variety of moves:  liebacks, jams, and some face climbing.  The crux is a short finger crack around mid-height.  This climb is in a very shady location.
content.location: This is a right-diagonaling crack, on the north face of the Heartless formation.
